subject: Real Estate
title: Google's Mountain View Land Monopoly
description: One-minute skill: Google's Mountain View Land Monopoly.

hook.text: Google owns or leases so much of Mountain View, California, that the city essentially revolves around it.

buildup.text: The company controls over 10 million square feet of office space â€” and keeps expanding.

discovery.text: Google's presence drove housing prices so high that teachers and firefighters can't afford to live there.

twist.text: The city tried to block Google's expansion. Google threatened to move. The city backed down.

climax.text: When one company dominates a city's real estate, the city becomes dependent on that company's success.

punchline.text: Google doesn't just work in Mountain View. It owns it.

quiz.question: How did Google's presence affect Mountain View housing?
options: Prices rose so high locals couldn't afford to live there
